results.title: Keating on Monet
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating recreates a river-side scene in winter using Monet painting techniques. Monet often worked on the River Seine in his painting boat. Keating provides biographical details, discusses his painter colleagues and their support of each other, his poverty and the difficulties in painting nature.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Manet
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating recreates the Manet painting “Olympia”, providing short biographical details, explaining the confident way in which he painted, expressing form very simply and juxtaposing warm and cool in his compositions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Renoir
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating paints a portrait using an artist’s model as his subject. He discusses Renoir’s limited palette, his influences and his eventual creation of a unique style of painting together with biographical details.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Constable
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, art forger explains how Constable always initiated his work from a black and white sketch, working on this to produce his final work. He examines “The Hay Wain” describing Constable’s use of shading techniques and his love of greys. Keating explains how Constable was never afraid to paint over yesterday’s work and suggests that Constable, although a rapid worker, would repaint until satisfied.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Cezanne
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, imitates and analyses the work of some of the world’s greatest artists and in this episode introduces Cezanne. He describes the incredibly slow pace at which Cezanne worked, both in arranging his compositions and painting them. Keating then gives biographical details of Cezanne, who was the son of a wealthy man, and he paints a still life in the style of Cezanne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Turner
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating shows how Turner, in his opinion, is the greatest of water colour artists. A reverse version of Turner’s famous work “The Fighting Temerara” is the subject of this program and we learn the techniques used by the artist to achieve the desired texture of the sky and the new Thames.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Impressionists
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating, art forger explains the importance of “plein air” painting to the Impressionists and paints pictures in the style of Rousseau, Boudin and Pisarro. While recreating the a Rousseau he talks about the palette of the painters, the techniques of painting trees and skies, and the different sense of values when painting outdoors or in a studio. He paints a “seaside” painting of Boudin using an initial wash and then making a simple figurative statement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Titian
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating discusses Titian’s early life and the artists who influenced his work. Keating recreates “Tarquin and Lucretia” taking the viewer through the various stages including scumbling, glazing and impasto.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Keating
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
In this episode world renowned art forger, Tom Keating, talks about his life, how he started to “fake” pictures for London dealers, his lifelong love of painting and of teaching the techniques of master painters to others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

results.title: Keating on Degas
results.creator_credit: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating describes Degas as a master in the use of pastels and describes the history of this medium. He examines the oil painting “The Dance Class”, which he then recreates in a pastel form.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Richard Fawkes, Richard Beighton, Channel 4 Television Corporation and Moving Picture Company

description_for_label:
Episode of Series “Keating on Painters Series”.
Tom Keating describes Degas as a master in the use of pastels and describes the history of this medium. He examines the oil painting “The Dance Class”, which he then recreates in a pastel form.
